EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT

RESOLUTION # 2010/2011-28

WHEREAS, Sections 45114, 45117, 45298 and 45308 of the California Education Code authorize the Board to terminate the service of such positions, for lack of funds, and/or lack of work;
	 
WHEREAS, this Board has determined that continued employment is no longer possible at the current levels for the positions listed below:

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  7.02
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Review, Consideration and Adoption of Resolution #2010/2011-29
Authorizing Reduction in Certificated Workforce
	 
	 
RESOLUTION OF
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
REDUCTION OF A PARTICULAR KIND OF SERVICE
	 
RESOLUTION # 2010/2011-29
	 
WHEREAS, the Superintendent of the East Side Union High School District (“District”), has recommended to the District’s Governing Board (“Board”) that the District reduce particular kinds of service no later than the beginning of the 2011-2012 school year; 
	 
WHEREAS, the recommendation includes the assessment that it shall be necessary to reduce the following particular kinds of service of the District no later than the beginning of the 2011-2012 school year:
	 
Kind of Service 
Number of Full-Time Equivalent Positions (“FTEs”)
Student Advisor
11.0
					 
Children’s Center Instructor
2.0
					 
Counselor
3.6
					 
Program Improvement in an Alternative Setting
(“PRIAS”) Teacher
					 
6.6
					 
Total FTEs
					 
23.2
	 
WHEREAS, the Governing Board is required by law to give notice, prior to March 15, 2011, to all certificated employees affected by any decision to reduce or eliminate this particular kind of service;
	 
IT IS RESOLVED THAT:
	 
A. The Board hereby determines to reduce services as specified in the recommendation set forth in the recitals above, no later than the beginning of the 2011-2012 school year.
	 
B. The Board hereby determines that, as the result of the above-stated reduction of particular kinds of service (the “Reduction in Force”), it will be necessary to terminate at the end of the 2010-2011 school year the employment of certificated employees of the District in a quantity and kind equal to the FTEs specified in the recommendation set forth in the recitals above.
	 
C. In order to implement this Reduction in Force, it may be necessary to apply tie-breaking criteria to distinguish among certificated employees who first rendered paid probationary service to the District on the same date.  Pursuant to Education Code section 44955(b), the Board determines that the order of layoff as between employees who first rendered paid service to the District on the same date shall be established on the basis of the criteria set forth in Exhibit A to this Resolution, which are incorporated as though fully set forth herein.
	 
D. The criteria set forth in Exhibit A to this Resolution shall also be used to determine the order of reemployment among those certificated employees who first rendered paid probationary service to the District on the same date.  The Superintendent, or his designee, has the discretion to determine the appropriate weight of such criteria and the order in which such criteria are most relevant to serve the needs of the District and students in each tie-breaking situation.
	 
E. The Superintendent is directed to send appropriate notices to all employees affected by the above-described reduction of a particular kind of service in accordance with the provisions of the California Education Code, to take all necessary action to implement this Resolution, and to afford the employees all rights to which they are entitled under the law and applicable Collective Bargaining Agreement(s).    
	 
	 
PASSED AND ADOPTED this 10th day of March, 2011.
	 
	 
                                                            BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE 
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
	 
	 
                                                            By:                                                                   
                                                                   Lan Nguyen
                                                                   President of the Board of Trustees of
                                                                   The East Side Union High School District
	 
	 
	 
                                                            By:                                                                   
                                                                   Van Le
                                                                   Clerk of the Board of Trustees of
                                                                   The East Side Union High School District
	 
	 
Exhibit A
	 
TIEBREAKING CRITERIA PURSUANT TO EDUCATION CODE SECTION 44955(b)
	 
Employees sharing the same first date of paid probationary service to the District shall be awarded tiebreaking points on the following basis:
	 
Criterion
Points
Possession of credential(s) authorizing service for the District
4 for each professional clear credential
					 
3for each preliminary credential
					 
2for intern credential
					 
1 for provisional internship permit or short-term staff permit
					 
					 
Possession of Cross-Cultural Language and Development certificate or its equivalent
					 
1
					 
					 
Possession of Bilingual Cross-Cultural Language
and Development certificate or its equivalent
					 
1
	 
Employees with a greater number of points shall be considered more senior than employees with a fewer number of points, for purposes of determining order of layoff and order of reemployment.
	 
If application of the foregoing criteria fails to resolve a tie among two or more employees, among the employees who remain tied the employee with the earliest date of issuance of a preliminary or professional clear credential shall be considered the more senior employee.  As among employees who remain tied who have never obtained a preliminary or professional clear credential, the employee with the earliest date of issuance of an intern credential shall be considered the more senior employee.  As among employees who remain tied who have never obtained an intern, preliminary, or professional clear credential, the employee with the earliest date of issuance of an emergency or pre-intern credential, provisional intern permit or short-term staff permit shall be considered the more senior employee.
	 
The Superintendent is authorized to determine the number of tiebreaking points to be awarded to each employee and to determine the manner in which the tiebreaking criteria shall be applied to each employee.
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
CERTIFICATION
	 
	 
	 
STATE OF CALIFORNIA            )
                                                )
COUNTY OF SANTA CLARA      )

SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:15 p.m.
Proposed Adoption of the Initial Proposal for Successor Contract:  From East Side Union High School District to San Jose Federation of Teachers Local 957, AFT, AFL-CIO
	 
	 
The East Side Union High School District presents the following initial proposal to the San Jose Federation of Teachers Local 957, AFT, AFL-CIO for the 2011-2012 school year.  Pursuant to Government Code §3547 the District’s initial proposal must be presented to the public in open session at a public meeting.
	 
The District continues to acknowledge and appreciate the contributions made to its mission and programs by its certificated employees, and continues to seek the utilization of equitable and collaborative methods of addressing the needs of the students, parents and employees of the East Side Union High School District.  Accordingly, the District initially proposes to continue the language of the present agreement for the 
2011-2012 school year except as modified in a manner consistent with the matters and issues described below.
	 
The District continues to experience severe financial constraints arising from a variety of factors.  The District views financial issues in the context of keeping the District solvent, maintaining the legally required reserves, and preserving the quality education for the students of the District.  Given the above, the District proposes the following areas for negotiations: total compensation which includes salary and benefits; and reduction of work year.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Various
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
To be negotiated
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board sunshine and accept any comment on the District’s initial proposal to the San Jose Federation of Teachers Local 957, AFT, AFL-CIO.

TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Employment Contract for Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services
	 
	 
Board of Trustees approval is recommended for the employment contract of Mr. Hardy Childers to serve as Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services as the District proceeds with the recruitment of the Associate Superintendent of Business Services to replace the individual who recently retired from that position.
	 
Background
Mr. Childers brings over thirty years of directly relevant experience and knowledge to assist the District during this transition period.
Summary 
Services performed by Mr. Hardy Childers in the position of Interim Associate Superintendent of Business Services will include all aspects of needed services and attendance at meetings as directed by the Superintendent.  The payroll rate for services will be based on actual days worked, at the rate of $1,000.00 per day for approximately 38 days between February 2011 and May 2011.  The designated work days and duties and any changes in Mr. Childers’ work schedule are subject to approval by the Superintendent.
	 
Fiscal Impact
	The fiscal impact is within the budget funded for the position of Associate Superintendent of Administration and Business Services.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
Item: 7.07
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:  
Dan Moser, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Hardy Childers, Interim Associate Superintendent, Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Approve Second Interim Financial Report for 2010/2011
	 
AB 2861 requires county and district superintendents to prepare and submit twice annually Interim Financial Reports.  The purpose of the Interim Report is to advise administrators, the Board of Trustees, the public, and other interested parties of the District's current and projected financial condition at periodic intervals during the fiscal year, and to show that the District will maintain a balanced budget with required reserves for the current year and the next two fiscal years as shown on the Multi-Year Projection Disclosure Report.  On the basis of these Interim Financial Reports, the Board must certify that the District will or will not be able to meet its financial obligations.
	 
Based upon the projections presented, the District will be able to meet its obligations with required reserves for the current year and the next fiscal year as shown on the Multi-Year Projection Disclosure Report; however, based on these projections, the District will not meet the required 3% reserve level in fiscal year 2012-13 without additional revenues and/or expenditure reductions totaling approximately $4.8 million.  As a result, California Education Code Section 42131,e; requires any school district that files a qualified or negative Second Interim Financial Report to prepare for the County Superintendent, Superintendent of Public Instruction and the State Controller a third financial statement projections of the district's fund and cash balances.
	 
Under the provisions of AB 1200, the Santa Clara County Office of Education has the responsibility to review and monitor school district budgets to provide a level of assurance that those budgets properly reflect the district’s current and projected financial status.  Accordingly, during the coming months, it is expected that the County Office of Education will require that the District develop a plan which will address projected deficit spending and restoration of the required reserve.
	 
The presentation to the Board of Trustees will include an overview of the status of the 2010-11 budget, a review of the key budget assumptions for the current and subsequent two years, and the multi-year financial projection.
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
On the basis of the financial reports and projections the Board has received and reviewed with staff for the period ended January 31, 2011 and projected through June 30, 2011, it is recommended that the Board approve the Second Interim Report on a qualified basis, certifying that East Side Union High School District will be able to meet its financial obligations with required reserves for fiscal year 2010-2011 and 2011-12, but is projected to fall short of meeting the 3% reserve requirement for 2012-13 by approximately $4.8 million.
